discussion.content:
USER PHONE NUMBER = (300 USERS X 1.1) + 10 = 340
TOLL FREE = either you memorise the number or estimate that every 25 users = 5 numbers, so 300 users = 60 numbers (so i will select 65)

comments.content:
So, with TOLL FREE = either you memorise the number or estimate that every 25 users = 5 numbers, so 300 users = 60 numbers (so i will select 65)
you are saying, to cut it short, every 5 user 0 one number? 300/5 = 60

discussion.content: I've passed MS-700 and still didn't know this one. MS really need to bring better focus to their exams!

comments.content: I agree too. Limits can change all the time too, how are we meant to keep up to date with that?

These memory type questions also have no place in the exam. In a real world situation, you wouldn't be expected to remember the exact numbers. It's a 2 second Google search and doesn't prove if you have a good understanding of 365 or not

discussion.content:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/how-many-phone-numbers-can-you-get

The number of phone numbers is equal to the total number of Domestic Calling Plan and/or Domestic and International Calling Plan licenses multiplied by 1.1 + 10 additional phone numbers.
Example: If I have 300 users in total with either a Domestic Calling Plan and/or Domestic and International Calling Plan, you can acquire 340 phone number (300 x 1.1 + 10).
---
The number of phone numbers is equal to the total number of Phone System and Audio Conferencing licenses and uses the following: If there are 200-499 licenses then 65 telephone numbers are given.
this qns came out in exam today

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that contains 300 users.
The users have Domestic and International Calling Plan licenses.
What is the maximum user phone numbers and toll-free service phone numbers can you acquire? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

You have a Microsoft 365 tenant.
You install the Microsoft Power Platform Center of Excellence (CoE) starter kit.
What is required to populate data in the CoE solution?

choices.A: Azure Logic Apps with the prefix Flow
choices.D: Microsoft Power Automate flows with the prefix Nurture
choices.C: Azure Functions with the prefix Sync
choices.B: Microsoft Power Automate flows with the prefix Sync

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The flows with the prefix Sync are required for populating and cleaning up data in the resource-elated Common Data Service entities Administration
(Environments, Power Apps Apps, Flows, Flow Action Details, Connectors, and Makers).
In order to activate each of these flows :
1. Save a copy of each of the flows outside the solution and name it as per your preferred terminology (e.g. with a prefix of “COE” )
2. Fix the connections in context of the current environment
3. Turn on each flow ( the starting flow “Admin | Sync Template v2” which causes the other flows to trigger should be turned on as the last one.)
4. Now Trigger the master flow - “Admin | Sync Template v2”

choices.B: a local number port order request
choices.C: Skype for Business Cloud Connector Edition

questions.question_text:
You have an on-premises call center and a Microsoft 365 E5 tenant.
You plan to implement Microsoft Phone System Direct Routing and Microsoft Teams.
What should you include in the solution?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
1GB per environment so 4GB in total.

comments.content: I would also go with 4GB. I didn't find information about database requirements of the trial environment, though.

discussion.content:
4GB looks correct based on this information in the link provided.

What is the Power Apps production environment limit?
Provisioning environments is based on database capacity. Previously, it was two environments per Power Apps Plan 2 license. Now all you need is 1GB of available capacity to provision. All environments with or without Dataverse will consume at least 1GB capacity.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 tenant.
You plan to create the Microsoft Power Platform environments shown in the following table.

What is the minimum amount of available database capacity required to create the environments?

You need to ensure that Office feature updates are installed by using the Semi-Annual Channel.
What should you configure from the Services page of the Microsoft 365 admin center?
